Toggle Menu

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox

Proxmox Cloud Module

New in version 2014.7.0.

The Proxmox cloud module is used to control access to cloud providers using the Proxmox system (KVM / OpenVZ).

Set up the cloud configuration at /etc/salt/cloud.providers or

/etc/salt/cloud.providers.d/proxmox.conf: 

my-proxmox-config:
  # Proxmox account information
  user: myuser@pam or myuser@pve
  password: mypassword
  url: hypervisor.domain.tld
  provider: proxmox
maintainer

Frank Klaassen <frank@cloudright.nl>

maturity

new

depends

requests >= 2.2.1

depends

IPy >= 0.81

avail_images

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.avail_images(
								call=None,
								location='local'
								)

Details

Return a list of the images that are on the provider

CLI Example:

salt-cloud --list-images my-proxmox-config

avail_locations

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.avail_locations(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the hypervisors (nodes) which this Proxmox PVE machine manages

CLI Example:

salt-cloud --list-locations my-proxmox-config

create

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.create(
								vm_
								)

Details

Create a single VM from a data dict

CLI Example:

salt-cloud -p proxmox-ubuntu vmhostname

create_node

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.create_node(
								vm_
								)

Details

Build and submit the requestdata to create a new node

destroy

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.destroy(
								name,
								call=None
								)

Details

Destroy a node.

CLI Example:

salt-cloud --destroy mymachine

get_configured_provider

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.get_configured_provider( )

Details

Return the first configured instance.

get_resources_nodes

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.get_resources_nodes(
								call=None,
								resFilter=None
								)

Details

Retrieve all hypervisors (nodes) available on this environment CLI Example: 

salt-cloud -f get_resources_nodes my-proxmox-config

get_resources_vms

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.get_resources_vms(
								call=None,
								resFilter=None,
								includeConfig=True
								)

Details

Retrieve all VMs available on this environment

CLI Example:

salt-cloud -f get_resources_vms my-proxmox-config

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.get_vm_status(
								vmid=None,
								name=None
								)

Details

Get the status for a VM, either via the ID or the hostname

Syntax

								node=None,

								)

Details

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.list_nodes(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the VMs that are managed by the provider

CLI Example:

salt-cloud -Q my-proxmox-config

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.list_nodes_full(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the VMs that are on the provider

CLI Example:

salt-cloud -F my-proxmox-config

list_nodes_select

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.list_nodes_select(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the VMs that are on the provider, with select fields

CLI Example:

salt-cloud -S my-proxmox-config

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.stop(
								name,
								vmid=None,
								call=None
								)

Details

Stop a node ("pulling the plug").

CLI Example:

salt-cloud -a stop mymachine

Syntax

								upid,
								timeout=300
								)

Details

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.proxmox.wait_for_state(
								vmid,
								state,
								timeout=300
								)

Details

Wait until a specific state has been reached on a node
